channel.title: CyberNetSec - Security Operations
channel.description: Latest security operations threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: Wireshark Vulnerabilities Create Denial-of-Service Risk for Security Teams
item.description:
France's national cybersecurity agency, CERT-FR, has issued a security advisory for two critical vulnerabilities in Wireshark, the world's most popular network protocol analyzer. The flaws, identified as CVE-2025-13945 and CVE-2025-13946, can be exploited by a remote attacker to cause a denial-of-se...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Security Operations

Read Full Article →

item.title: Cloudflare Outage Hits 28% of Global Traffic After Faulty React2Shell Patch
item.description:
Cloudflare, a leading internet infrastructure provider, experienced a 25-minute global outage on December 5, 2025, that impacted approximately 28% of its HTTP traffic and made numerous popular websites inaccessible. The company quickly confirmed the disruption was not a cyberattack but was self-infl...

Severity: High

Categories: Security Operations, Cyberattack, Patch Management

Read Full Article →

item.title: AWS Boosts Cloud Defense with New AI-Powered Security Tools at re:Invent 2025
item.description:
At its re:Invent 2025 conference, Amazon Web Services (AWS) unveiled several major additions to its security portfolio, heavily infused with artificial intelligence. Key announcements on December 3, 2025, included the preview of AWS Security Agent, a context-aware tool for proactive application secu...

Categories: Cloud Security, Security Operations, Patch Management

item.title: Lazarus APT's Remote IT Worker Infiltration Scheme Exposed in Real-Time
item.description:
A joint investigation by security researchers has exposed the inner workings of a North Korean Lazarus Group scheme where operatives commit identity fraud to get hired as remote IT workers at Western firms. By luring the threat actors into a sophisticated honeypot environment, researchers from BCA L...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Phishing, Security Operations

item.title: AI Cybersecurity Firm Tenex Expands to EMEA with New Funding
item.description:
AI-native cybersecurity firm Tenex announced its expansion into the Europe, Middle East, and Africa (EMEA) region on December 2, 2025. The strategic move is supported by a new Series A investment from the global investment firm DTCP. Tenex, which offers an AI-driven managed detection and response (M...

item.title: Global Infrastructure Breach Alert Confirmed as False Alarm
item.description:
Initial reports on November 30, 2025, of a major security breach impacting global infrastructure were officially confirmed to be a false alarm. The panic was triggered when automated monitoring tools misinterpreted routine, benign system tests as a sophisticated cyberattack, leading to a cascade of ...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Security Operations, Incident Response, Other

item.title: Massive Scan of Public GitLab Repositories Uncovers Over 17,000 Live Secrets
item.description:
A security engineer, Luke Marshall, conducted a large-scale scan of all 5.6 million public repositories on GitLab Cloud, uncovering 17,430 verified, live secrets. The exposed credentials include thousands of API keys and access tokens for over 2,800 unique domains, with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) k...

Severity: High

Categories: Cloud Security, Security Operations, Supply Chain Attack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Legacy Python Scripts Create Dormant Supply Chain Risk via Abandoned Domain
item.description:
Security researchers at ReversingLabs have identified a long-dormant supply chain vulnerability within the Python ecosystem affecting packages that use the legacy 'zc.buildout' tool. Outdated bootstrap scripts (`bootstrap.py`) found in several PyPI packages contain hardcoded references to an abandon...

Severity: High

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Vulnerability, Security Operations

Read Full Article →

item.title: Supply Chain Breaches Escalate Despite Maturing Defenses, Report Finds
item.description:
A new 2025 report from cybersecurity firm BlueVoyant reveals a troubling trend: despite most organizations maturing their third-party risk management (TPRM) programs, the number of supply chain breaches is escalating. The study found that 97% of surveyed organizations experienced a supplier-related ...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Security Operations, Policy and Compliance, Supply Chain Attack

item.title: Ransomware Attacks Peak on Holidays and Weekends, Exploiting Low Staffing
item.description:
A new global study by Semperis, the "2025 Holiday Ransomware Risk Report," confirms that threat actors strategically launch attacks during holidays and weekends to exploit reduced security staffing. The report found that 52% of organizations were targeted during these off-hour periods. Alarmingly, 7...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Security Operations, Ransomware, Incident Response
